MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay Parse(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified into a object.
Docs.returns: A object that is obtained from .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay.Parse%2A> method is capable of parsing strings in various formats. The recognizable string formats are "---ddzzz" and "---dd", which are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |dd|The day of the month. Single-digit days have a leading zero.|23, 09| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero. "Z" means the current time zone.|-07:00, +08:00, Z|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay.Parse%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay/CPP/demo.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDay/CS/demo.cs#11)]

Docs.exception: does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
